entry.title: Next-Level Demos: SAP Business One Localized Demo Databases are Updated and Available
entry.content:
We‚Äôre excited to share that the SAP Business One localized demo databases have been upgraded to the latest release, 10.0 FP 2508, and are now available for download!
This update includes fresh transactional data to ensure your demo environments look clean, current, and professional.

The localized demo databases offer a fully pre-configured SAP Business One setup across 39 localizations, based on the model company OEC Computers. They are available for both MS SQL and SAP HANA platforms.

Whether you're demonstrating, learning, teaching, or testing SAP Business One, this refreshed demo environment is designed to support your goals with greater clarity and realism.

Download the Localized Demo Databases for SAP Business One

entry.title: Re: Map format data field FPAYHX-REF01
entry.content:
Hello @yk21 

Thanks for reaching out. In response to your questions, below are some helpful SAP official documentation for public use.

What is FPAYHX-REF01? It is an extra reference slot at the header level within the payment medium data model. It‚Äôs not populated by default, SAP Help Portal-Including Custom Reference Fields

To populate it, follow these steps in Cloud-safe in Custom Fields and Logic, SAP Help Portal, including Custom Reference Fields

Map Format Data for Payments. SAP Help Portal-Map Format Data for Payments

Create a payment file and confirm in Payment Media ‚Üí Display File. SAP Community: Analyse the Processing of Outgoing Payment Files from Map Format Data

About the tcodes mentioned earlier, those are on-premises configuration tools and not used in Public Cloud. For the S/4HANA Public Cloud Edition, payment-format mapping is done with the Map Format Data for Payments app and other configuration activities are done via SSCUI/CBC activities, no tcodes in Public cloud

With best regards

Chuma

entry.title: Re: GL account determination vendor consignment process i...
entry.content:
In a standard PO GR (101), the system posts to stock and to the GR/IR clearing account, and if you have delivery cost or surcharge condition types with an account key in the pricing procedure, they are picked up in MM account determination (OBYC).

In a consignment PO, the initial GR (101‚ÄØK) doesn‚Äôt post to vendor liability; it just increases consignment stock (vendor‚Äëowned). The 411‚ÄØK transfer posting moves stock from consignment to own stock and posts the vendor liability at that point. The 411‚ÄØK posting logic does not re‚Äëread the PO pricing conditions.  It uses the valuation class and transaction key for consignment liability (KON) from OBYC. If your new condition type is not part of the account determination for transaction key KON (or whatever key is used for 411‚ÄØK in your config), it will never be picked up.

Please check the following:

  • In OMJJ, check movement type 411‚ÄØK ‚Üí Account Grouping (AcctGrp) for posting to vendor. This grouping is used in OBYC to find the GL account.
  • For 411‚ÄØK, the system uses transaction key KON (consignment liabilities) for the vendor posting. If your condition type is meant to post separately, you need an account key in the pricing procedure for that condition type. A corresponding entry in OBYC for that account key and the relevant valuation class/account grouping.
  • If your condition type is an accrual (delivery cost), ensure the accrual key is maintained in the pricing procedure and in OBYC for the relevant transaction key used in 411‚ÄØK.

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Learn more about the SAP Support user and program here.

entry.title: Re: Unable to Remove "Actual hours worked" Times From an...
entry.content:
The recorded times cannot be removed because they have been booked through Service Confirmations and the documents are already in finished status. Once the cycle of a document is finished, it is not possible to remove the times related to it. This is the standard system behavior.

You can refer to KBA - https://me.sap.com/notes/3415556

entry.title: Re: Manual Cheque Number Assignment for Outgoing Payments
entry.content: Yes, this applies to SAP S/4HANA Private Cloud 2023. Use transaction FCHI or the corresponding Fiori App ("Manage Check Lots"), not the SPRO activity FCHL. If you cannot access FCHI, it is a standard access control issue in the cloud edition. Please contact your project team or system administrator to grant the necessary authorization (e.g., for transaction FCHI or the corresponding business catalog for the Fiori app).

entry.title: Re: BAPI_BUPA_CREATE_FROM_DATA Failed, please help me. Th...
entry.content:
Two areas you need to investigate based on my observation.
After calling the BAPI, you must commit the transaction. Without this, the business partner is not saved to the database. Next, you're using 'Z' for partnerlanguage. This should be a valid SAP language key like 'E' (English), 'D' (German), etc.  Please recheck these two.

entry.title: Support for Base64-Encoded Fingerprints in SFTP Adapter
entry.content:
Introduction: When working with the SFTP Adapter in SAP Process Orchestration, one critical step during the SSH handshake is the validation of the server fingerprint. This fingerprint ensures that the adapter is connecting to the correct server and not an imposter, thereby guaranteeing the authenticity of the communication channel.

Traditionally, server fingerprints were shared in hexadecimal format (e.g., MD5:9c:b9:de:cc:... or SHA1:3f:17:6c:bb:...). However, many modern servers now provide fingerprints in Base64 format (e.g., SHA256:rmwIF2dwgkeh0m/...).

This difference in representation can lead to problems when setting up or running an SFTP channel, especially if the adapter only expects a hex-formatted fingerprint while the server provides Base64.

Problem / Symptom: The fingerprint mismatch often surfaces as a runtime error during message processing. For example, you might notice the following entry in the channel logs:

Exception received: com.jcraft.jsch.JSchException: Fingerprint invalid. Fingerprint is: SHA256:rmwIF2dwgkeh0m/...

At first glance, the fingerprint looks valid as it is prefixed with SHA256:. But the problem is that the adapter expects a hexadecimal value, whereas the server has sent the fingerprint in Base64 encoding. Because of this mismatch, the adapter cannot validate the server during the SSH handshake, and message processing fails.

Solution: To address this issue, the SFTP Adapter has been enhanced to support Base64-encoded server fingerprints (e.g., SHA256:rmwIF2dwgkeh0m/...).

A new advanced mode parameter has been introduced:

useBase64Fingerprint (default: false)

  • Default behavior (false)
    If the parameter is not set or explicitly set to false, the adapter automatically converts Base64-encoded server fingerprints into the expected hexadecimal format before performing validation.
    • Example:
      • Server Fingerprint (Base64): SHA256:rmwIF2dwgkeh0m/...
      • Channel Fingerprint (configured in Hex): ae:6c:08:17:67:70:82:47:...
      • Adapter converts Base64 ‚Üí Hex internally, then compares.
  • When set to true
    The adapter directly reads the server fingerprint in Base64 format. In this case, the channel must also be configured with the fingerprint in Base64 format.
    • Example:
      • Server Fingerprint (Base64): SHA256:rmwIF2dwgkeh0m/...
      • Channel Fingerprint (Base64): SHA256:rmwIF2dwgkeh0m/...
      • Both are compared as Base64 strings.

This enhancement gives flexibility for both legacy configurations (hex fingerprints) and modern servers (Base64 fingerprints), ensuring compatibility and reducing configuration errors.

For SP/patch level details following SAP Note can be referred: 3652688 - Support for Base64-Encoded Fingerprints in SFTP Adapter

entry.title: Re: Italy pre-configured Tax Codes in SAP S/4HANA Public...
entry.content:
For a non-deductible input tax scenario, the entire tax amount should be posted as a debit to the expense account. There should be no credit to Output VAT GL. The vendor line item should reflect the gross amount (net + tax), with no separate VAT credit.

If that is not happening, review your Tax Code configuration and see that the ‚ÄúNon-deductible‚Äù flag is properly set for Tax Code X0. Ensure deductible percentage = 0% and non-deductible = 100%. EU Code 9 is typically used for reverse charge or zero balance acquisition tax. If this is not a reverse charge scenario, consider changing the EU Code to one that reflects non-deductible domestic input tax

entry.title: Re: Massive clean-up of old email addresses in SU01
entry.content: Hello @Selle1, if "resigned user" means offboarded user, someone who left and does not need SAP account anymore, this user should be deactivated - validity limited to the end of employee contract validity, roles removed and user locked in all SAP systems where exists. We also set Usergroup DEACTIVATED to as another marking of "dead access". Most of these SAP accounts have e-mail address filled in User Master Data, but we keep personal data including e-mail in SU01. But if would be required to remove some personal data like e-mail address, I would use GRC Access Request as we usually use for User Master Data changes. Mass changes are possible and logged by this tool. There are also other ways, a bit dirty, but it's a question if would be accepted by auditor/s. Olga

entry.title: Reporting of GHG emissions - Receiving of actual emissions sent by your carrier
entry.content:
Transportation Management (TM) in SAP S/4HANA 2023 introduces enhanced capabilities for calculating, incorporating into planning, and visualizing the carbon footprint of transportation.

However, there is more to it. Sustainability as part of Transportation Management offers a comprehensive overview of these features. In the blog post titled "Maintain Carbon Emission on Vehicle Type" authored by my colleague Michael Haase, we detail the necessary master data setup for accurate calculations.

Additionally, we provide the option to manually maintain received actual emission values for your Transportation Orders, as provided by the carrier. What has been lacking, until now, is the capability to automatically update these actual values using an API.

In this blog post, we aim to equip you with the tools necessary to achieve automated actual emission value updates on the header level, contributing to your sustainability journey.

KBA 3654588 outlines the step-by-step process for accomplishing this.

Following the approach detailed, an inbound message, sent externally‚Äîfor instance, by the carrier‚Äîwill include two new fields: one for the emission value and another for the unit of measure. 

                            
<TransportationEventNotificationMessage>
<MessageHeader>
</MessageHeader>
<TransportationEvent>
<ObjectReference>
<TransportationOrderID>61001369908</TransportationOrderID>
</ObjectReference>
<Event>
<EventTypeCode>REPORT_EMIVAL_DOC</EventTypeCode>
<EventReasonText>CO2 emission Updated.</EventReasonText>
<ExpectedDateTime>XXX</ExpectedDateTime>
<EstimatedDateTime/>
<ActualDateTime>XXX</ActualDateTime>
<n1:EmissionValue xmlns:n1="http://gtt.com/xi/TMS/EventNotif_In">1256</n1:EmissionValue>
<n1:EmissionValueUom xmlns:n1="http://gtt.com/xi/TMS/EventNotif_In">KG</n1:EmissionValueUom>
</Event>
</TransportationEvent>
</TransportationEventNotificationMessage>

Fig. 1 illustrates the enhanced payload.

This will update your Freight Order 61001369908 accordingly. Activating the views for carbon emissions in the Freight Order will display a window that shows the reported carbon emissions.

Fig. 2 illustrates the reported carbon emissions.

Navigating to the Execution Tab displays event information. Specifically, we are interested in the event that pertains to the reported emission values.

Fig. 3 illustrates the received event 'Report Emission Values for Documents' as part of your execution data.

 

That's it for now.

Stay tuned, there is even more to come.

October 15, 2025

Agenda

We are pleased to invite you to the SAP MaxAttention Innovation Workshop focusing on ‚ÄòSAP Business Data Cloud: Advance into a bold new era of data and AI‚Äô taking place virtually on October 15th, 2025. Please find the current agenda here.

In this workshop, you will explore how SAP Business Data Cloud (BDC) is redefining enterprise data management and laying the foundation for AI innovation across the business landscape. You will walk away with a clear understanding of how to transition to SAP Business Data Cloud, what technical and strategic value it brings, and how it can power a bold new era of data-driven innovation and AI-readiness. entry.title: Re: How are markup, customs, and freight amounts‚Äîposted t...
entry.content:
The origin group is typically used to categorize costs for cost component splits or detailed analysis. But if the system is configured correctly, actual costing will still absorb the values from MIGO postings; even without origin group, because the material ledger captures all inventory-relevant postings.

So to answer your question, Yes, in SAP S/4HANA, markup, customs, and freight posted via purchase conditions at MIGO can be added to actual costing without using the origin group. The key is to ensure that the condition types are inventory-relevant, mapped to cost-relevant account keys, and that the material ledger is active. This setup allows the costs to be absorbed into the material‚Äôs actual cost during goods receipt

entry.title: Duplicated invoice posting issues for ERS job
entry.content:
Dear SAP Support,

We"ve met duplicated invoice posting issues for ERS job.

Background: When we create Purchase order, post goods issue, we use ERS function, schedule supplier invoice job, to create the invoice every day. Normally, once the invoice was posted for the goods receipt document, at the next day, it won"t create the invoice again.

Problem: We have purchase order 4500004906, the goods receipt document 500000263 was reversed by 500000264 on the same day before ERS job run.

When run ERS job, it created a supplier invoice job with amount 0.

The problem is that system created the supplier invoice with amount 0 every day for the same goods receipt document 500000263 and 500000264.

Questions:

Why system can create the supplier invoice many times for the same goods receipt document (with its reversal document)?

Why ERS job can create the supplier invoice job with amount 0? (When use APP "Create supplier invoice, it cannot post the invoice with amount 0).

Temporary solution:

There are many reversal GR documents like above example, we cancelled the job, and rescheduled it, changed the goods receipt posting date from Sep.12, then the problem is solved.

Questions: How can we avoid such duplicated posting issues in future?

Thank you.

Best Regards,

Grace

entry.title: Re: Code Vulnerability Analyzer Checks
entry.content:
Dear Martin,

All CVA checks are listed in SAP Note 1921820. You can identify new checks by the "Release" column.

Regarding SAP Note 3326886 ‚Äì yes, you are right. It is not possible to provide complete protection using only static security scans; you also need other security measures. The situation is similar to AUTHORITY-CHECK: you may have correct AUTHORITY-CHECK statements in your code, but they will not help if users have inappropriate authorizations, e.g., SAP_ALL.

entry.title: Re: Bridging the gap with SAP S/4HANA Cloud Safekeeper
entry.content:
No. Safekeeper is only available as an upsell for RISE with SAP S/4HANA cloud, private edition / SAP Cloud ERP Private cloud services or RISE with SAP S/4HANA cloud, private edition, tailored option / SAP Cloud ERP Private, tailored option cloud services.

Safekeeper is not available for on-premise solutions.

On-premise customers that want to utilize Safekeeper need to move to RISE with SAP S/4HANA cloud, private edition / SAP Cloud ERP Private or RISE with SAP S/4HANA cloud, private edition, tailored option / SAP Cloud ERP Private, tailored option while their system is still in Mainstream or Extended Maintenance in order to then afterwards be in a position to benefit from Safekeeper.

As an example, a customer on SAP S/4HANA on-premise release 1709 would have to move to RISE before end of 2025 to then benefit from Safekeeper in the time frame Jan 1, 2026 to March 31, 2028.

entry.title: Re: Duplicated invoice posting issues for ERS job
entry.content:
I could see two reasons to your root cause of the issue for the system Creating Duplicate Invoices with Amount 0.

ERS jobs evaluate open GRs for invoicing. If a GR is reversed after posting but before ERS runs, the system still sees the original GR as eligible. The reversal document doesn‚Äôt always block the original GR from being picked up‚Äîespecially if the reversal is on the same day and the ERS job doesn‚Äôt check reversal status properly.

When the ERS job picks up both the original GR and its reversal, the net quantity becomes zero. The system still tries to post an invoice, resulting in a zero-amount invoice. The ‚ÄúCreate Supplier Invoice‚Äù app has stricter validation and blocks zero-amount invoices, but ERS jobs don‚Äôt always enforce that.

To fix this permanently, exclude the reversed GRs from ERS selection. This you can do with your ERS job variant or selection logic filters out reversed GRs, like movement type 102 or 122 should not be considered in your filter.

entry.title: Re: SAC date filter in story: how to get most current dat...
entry.content:
@Sascha_Wahl 

I do not think there is a standard straightforward solution for this. May be you can try a workaround. Create a table with very limited data which is most guaranteed to exist. Set the filter of this table to current year and months with booked behavior for date. You can read the date filter from this table using scripting which would return an array of months. Find the max of this values. mostly it would be the last value of the array. Now use this value to set the story filter.

Helpful API's

getdimensionfilter, setDimensionFilterWithHierarchy

https://help.sap.com/doc/1639cb9ccaa54b2592224df577abe822/release/en-US/index.html#FileDataSource

 

Hope this helps !!

Nikhil
